result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher T. Hayden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Pepin County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I agree to undergo random drug testing at the direction of my probation agent as well as directed by the DA's office.
B.  I understand that a drug test violation will be considered a violation of this agreement.
C.  I will complete 80 hours of community service through B-P CJCC.  Termination from this program will be considered a violation of this agreement.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 10-01-2019 following Probation Review Hearing.  10 days jail ordered to commence 12-02-2019 @ 9:00 am unless all court ordered obligations are paid in full.
AMENDED 11-25-2019 following Probation Review Hearing.  Court extends probation for 6 months instead of the 10 days jail and authorize early release upon payment in full of $518.00.
AMENDED 02-10-2020.  Correction to the Amended JOC Filed 12-02-2019 at request of DOC to remove the 6 months stated in the length of sentence as the term of probation cannot be added into the original term of probation on the JOC.

miscConds.notes: Costs/surcharges to be paid according to a schedule set forth by Probation & Parole.

Comply with any assessment or treatment set up by Probation & Parole.
No possession or consumption of alcohol.
No other illegal activity.

timeConds.notes: Serve 30 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:46 AM  Recorded in Buffalo County.  Hearing conducted by Telephone.  Defendant Christopher T. Hayden appeared by phone means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Hearing held pn November 25th with $518 owing and probation was extended for 6 months.  Was going to pay the balance of $50 today on-line which is the balance owing.  You are due to discharge on 5/25, if this is not paid in full on 5/8 at close of business, report to jail on 5/9 at 9:00 a.m. for 10 days.  Court obligations be paid and supervision fees be paid.  Probation can terminate after you pay.  If you go to jail, will order judgment for unpaid costs.
Probation review hearing on April 28, 2020 at 10:45 am.

09:38 AM Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court.  Court will either extend probation or have same jail term starting 12/2.  Mr. Hayden chooses to extend probation.  Court extends probation for 6 months and authorize early discharge upon payment of $518.
Probation review hearing on November 25, 2019 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing after motion to revoke DPA and Probation Review Hrg. in 16CM02 for failure to complete community service.  P&P Agent informs defendant didn't follow through with LE Phillips treatment program and he will need to finish that program.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs probation in 15CF47; 30 days in the PCJ w/work release report 12/26 at 6:00 p.m.; pay costs; comply with any assessment or treatment set up by P&P; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no other illegal activity; advised of felony prohibitions; appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing to revoke DPA and Probation Review Hrg.  Defendant agrees he did not complete community service.  Court finds grounds exists.  State's closing arguments.  Defendant addresses the Court.  Court revokes the DPA, find you guilty of burglary.  No request by counsel for PSI.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing hrg. and PRH on the other matter.
Motion hearing on November 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Revoke DPA.  Counsel confirms receipt of Motion, opposes motion and requests more time.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Atty S. Joseph Randtke appt'd.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing on defendant failed to complete C/S, terminated from the program and State's motion to revoke felony DPA.  Court advises defendant of right to attorney.  Matter adjourned to allow defendant to contact an attorney, informed to contact the SPD office before leaving today to see if qualifies for an attorney.  Motion Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement
Motion hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S.  Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Deferred Acceptance of No Contest Plea Agreement.
Received for Filing & Electronically 1/28/2016.

Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge of burglary/max penalties; to charge of misdemeanor theft in 16CM02/max penalties and criminal tresspass/max. penalties. Defendant enters pleas of no contest to each count.  Plea Colloquy.  State moves to rescind motion to revoke bond in 15CF47, dismiss 15CF51.  Court finds defendant guilty of 2 counts in 16CM02, withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation w/conditions; Dismiss 15CF51; motion to revoke bond w/drawn; bond vacated.

Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead to count 1 in 15CF47 as DAGPA, and to newly filed charges in 16CM02, joint recommendation 2 yrs. probation, 10 days jail, 5 days credit.  State will dismiss 15CF51.  Court advises defendant of right to Prelim. Hrg.  Defendant waives PH, bound over.  Court informs usually State files an Information at this time, defendant agrees to use complaint.  State to supplement the record.

Adjourned initial appearance at 01-25-2016 03:00 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing at 01-25-2016 03:00 pm.
Attorney Patrick William Waters in court.  Defendant f/t/a.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Referred to scheduling clerk for cont'd initial appearance.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-05-2016 02:30 pm
Cont'd.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant continues to waive TL for PH.  State filed motion to forfeit $1000 Sign. Bond and filed new charge 15CF51 for felony bail jumping.  Defendant on Sign. Bond on 15CF47, on cash bond in Buffalo Co.  State requests $2500 cash bond on felony bail jumping.  Atty Waters requests court not forfeit bond and ask not to set cash bond.  Court won't set bond on new case as on bond in Buffalo County.  Defendant waives TL for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Amended 10-06-2015:  Defendant may be released to enter into a residential inpatient treatment program.

Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court with attorney Patrick Waters.  Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in custody.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Waters informs court Mr. Hayden has been accepted into treatment in Florida Treasurer Coast Recovery in Stuart, FL as in-patient treatment for 30 days, with a bed available.  State has no objection to inpatient treatment as long as defendant returns when finished.  Defendant's mother here who will take him to the airport.  Court modifies bond upon purchase of plane ticket to allow defendant to be released to enter into a residential inpatient treatment program.  Defendant waives time limits for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher T. Hayden in court, in custody.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  You have now been handed a copy of the CC.    Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charge/max. penalties, constitutional rights and right to a preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $1000 cash bond appropriate.  Burglary prompted by drug behavior.   Court informs the defendant to contact the PD office, they will be here tomorrow.  Court sets $1000 cash bond return tomorrow @ 2:00 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
